oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cryptanalysis of 48-step RIPEMD-160
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wang, Gaoli
Shen, Yanzhao
Liu, Fukang
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hash functions
RIPEMD-160
Semi-free-start collision
Generalized message modification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we show how to theoretically compute the step differential probability of RIPEMD-160 under the condition that only one internal variable contains difference and the difference is a power of 2. Inspired by the way of computing the differential probability, we can do message modification such that a step differential hold with probability 1. Moreover, we propose a semi-free-start collision attack on 48-step RIPEMD-160, which improves the best semi-free start collision by 6 rounds. This is mainly due to that some bits of the chaining variable in the i-th step can be computed by adding some conditions in advance, even though some chaining variables before step i are unknown. Therefore, the uncontrolled probability of the differential path is increased and the number of the needed starting points is decreased. Then a semi-free-start collision attack on 48-step RIPEMD-160 can be obtained based on the differential path constructed by Mendel et al. at ASIACRYPT 2013. The experiments confirm our reasoning and complexity analysis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: IACR Transactions on Symmetric Cryptology; Volume 2017, Issue 2; 177-202
